entry.title: can't stand to see you leaving lonely
entry.summary:
Author: costasiellak

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,409Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 12

Summary: He needed to know. That wasn’t quite true; he needed it confirmed. He had known for far longer than he thought even Bruce knew. They had met two years before and had been best friends for most of it; at this point, Clark thought about Bruce more than he thought about himself. So yes, Clark definitely knew.“I don’t know how much longer I can keep eating these, Clark, they’re quite—”“You’re in love with me.” Bruce has been in love with Clark for years, which Clark knows. But he definitely doesn't return the feelings. Right?

entry.summary:
Author: crazyredd

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,551Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 43

Summary: Clark’s heart sank as he looked towards Bruce. They’d had this restaurant reservation for weeks now and it feels like they rarely have any time when they’re both free.“I’ve just been called into work. Perry specifically requested me,” Clark sighed heavily as he lied.Bruce couldn’t hide the disappointment on his face.But before he could say anything he looked up at Clark and saw a beam of light out the window past his shoulder. The Bat-Signal.

entry.title: Whispers through the grapevine
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,810Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 4

Summary: There were whispers in the court, among the maids, and among the soldiers alike that the second Prince had a secret lover. Their kind, brave, and lovable prince had been seduced by a harlot who would visit the Prince's chamber every night and leave by sunrise, unheard and unseen.But Bruce knew, and he knew more than he needed to be. There had not been a single whisper that could escape his ear and the truth always followed not so far behind.Clark had entangled himself in a trivial love affair with his loyal soldier, the Emerald Knight, Hal Jordan. Someone important enough for Bruce, the true First Prince of El, to remember yet insignificant enough for him not to bat an eye. A nobody who would play a role as his half-brother's first heartbreak, a mere pebble on Kal-El's road to maturity, and the first brush strokes that would be layered with many more in Kal-El's canvas of life.That was what Bruce had thought.But it seemed like the Emerald Knight had a knack for proving him wrong.

entry.title: Like Cats and Dogs
entry.summary:
Author: bajuwa

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 73,932Chapters: 30/32Kudos: 1,950

Summary: In a world where soulmates are represented by animal familiars, Clark wonders if his soulmate is a cat. A literal domesticated feline animal that one could get from the pet store and not just a person with some cat-like personality traits. There’s no other explanation as to why his familiar acts like every single asshole cat meme to ever exist.On the off chance his soulmate is a real human being, well… He would never tell his mother this, she raised him too well, but sometimes Clark wishes his soulmate’s familiar was making him feel just as miserable.---Bruce peels his eyes away from the monitors to look down at the menace on his lap and barely contains a look of disgust. Big blue eyes stare up at him as he rests his chin on Bruce’s thigh, and as their eyes meet, the pathetic, whimpering little whines are replaced by excited huffs, the clickity clack of dancing paws on concrete, and the rhythmic thumping of his tail hitting the leg of the table.Why does it have to be so needy and cuddly all the time?(new chapters every Tuesday and Friday!)

entry.title: A Clash of Ideals
entry.summary:
Author: mustangisinflames

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,921Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 11

Summary: "The whirring Clark had heard coming from the hood earlier was now almost a distressed whine and he watched, entranced, as the pronged ears tipped back, lying flat against the curve like- like he was holding an animal in his hand, not a person. Not a human.Teeth and harrowing black eyes and what Clark realised with a sinking feeling in his gut were claws embedded into the fingertips of sturdy gloves, the curves of metal filed into cruel points, raking uselessly against his own arm but managing to tear neatly into the fabric of his sleeve. As the Batman thrummed with rage and sneered, entirely ineffective but damn well not going to go down without a fight if he had to, Clark saw all the ways the man had put himself together, fine tuned himself into a weapon of fear and vengeance, and couldn’t help but feel sorry for him.What turns a man into something like this?"-Superman meets Batman. At least it could've gone worse, right?

entry.title: Make It Wayne
entry.summary:
Author: waynewolfling

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,366Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 148

Summary: Gotham’s most infamous billionaire playboy, Bruce Wayne, has spent years building a reputation—just not a good one. Between scandalous headlines, a trail of ex-lovers, and his ridiculous reality TV show, Make It Wayne, no one takes him too seriously. And that’s exactly how he likes it.But when life introduces him to one encounter after another with a painfully charming journalist, Bruce starts to wonder if he’s finally losing control of the carefully crafted mess that is his life.(Or: Bruce Wayne is a disaster, Clark Kent supposedly has his life together, and somehow, feelings start getting involved. And a bunch of other stuff happens.)

entry.title: A Love Story For The Time Being
entry.summary:
Author: ok_this_is_love

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,065Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 168

Summary: Bruce shifts beside him. Clark hears the faint crinkle of foil, the rustle of gloves against packaging as Bruce tears open one of his awful protein bars. The ones that taste like sawdust and regret, packed with just enough nutrients to keep him running on fumes for another few hours.And then--Bruce breaks it in half.Clark barely has time to process before a piece is being shoved into his palm, fingers brushing against his own for the briefest second before Bruce pulls away, like the whole motion is nothing. Like it’s casual.

entry.title: Feverish
entry.summary:
Author: lostinreeverie

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,202Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 94

Summary: The sight of Clark lying motionless on his bed stopped Bruce cold. The man looked like death warmed over—pale, drenched in sweat, his breathing shallow and labored. For a split second, Bruce’s heart skipped a beat. The Superman he knew, the symbol of strength and invincibility, was nowhere to be found. In his place was a man—his Clark—utterly vulnerable. Clark’s eyes fluttered open as Bruce rushed to his side, his voice barely a whisper. "Bruce... I think I'm dying." Or, Clark is sick and Bruce takes it upon himself to take care of the man who’s always been there for everyone else.
